metadata.title: CVE-2021-4202 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
A use-after-free flaw was found in nci_request in net/nfc/nci/core.c in NFCController Interface (NCI) in the Linux kernel. This flaw could allow alocal attacker with user privileges to cause a data race problem while thedevice is getting removed, leading to a privilege escalation problem.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-4202` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-229-generic - 4.4.0-229.263~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-229-generic - 4.4.0-229.263~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-229-lowlatency - 4.4.0-229.263~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1109-aws - 4.4.0-1109.115
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1131-azure - 4.15.0-1131.144~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-229.263~14.04.1').
linux-aws package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1109.115').
linux-azure package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1131.144~14.04.1').
